channel.title: Recoloring

item.title: Recoloring
item.dc:creator: @Surfr Surfr
item.description:
@Surfr wrote:

You cannot recolour items using ints.

You have to manually edit the object in a 3d modeling program and load the models into your client.

And to solve your animation problem, search for this is c.j

public int GetWepAnim() {

under add something like.

if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == #####) //item id { return 1658; }

Read full topic

item.title: Recoloring
item.dc:creator: @xXx_gl0wi_xXx xXx gl0wi xXx
item.description:
@xXx_gl0wi_xXx wrote:

if(i == 4151){ class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[1]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = 61; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 6073; class8.anInt174 = 5037; class8.anInt181 = 770; class8.anInt190 = 164; class8.anInt198 = 156; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt169 = 3; class8.anInt194 = -3; class8.anInt165 = 4954; class8.anInt200 = 5031; class8.anInt188 = -1; class8.anInt164 = -1; class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.anInt197 = -1; class8.aString170 = "Lava whip"; class8.aByteArray178 = "Lava whip".getBytes(); }
